DOC.detailed_description: Approximately 15 % woman experience perinatal depression ( depression pregnancy postpartum ) . Furthermore , 38 % low income woman experience postpartum depression ( Gree-Smith et al. , 2012 ) . Perinatal depression associate numerous maternal ( e.g. , weight retention ) , infant ( e.g. , poor infant-child bond ) , lifespan ( e.g. , behavior problem ) consequence ( Barker et al. , 2011 , Herring et al. , 2008 , Hipwell et al. , 2000 ) . Psychosocial intervention efficacious perinatal depression ; however , 10 % woman seek treatment ( Oppo et al. , 2009 ) . There need innovative , low cost intervention integrate within exist community-based program serve woman need ( e.g. , low income woman ) . Preliminary evidence indicates exercise may novel , efficacious intervention . The primary aim study examine efficacy novel exercise intervention design prevent perinatal depression among woman attend federally qualify health center serve high risk woman . Possible effect gestational weight gain retention also explore . This study build upon study team 's previous work recruit low income woman integrate intervention community-based clinic . Participants ( n=200 ) low income pregnant ( le 20 week ) randomly assign either telephone-based intervention previously show increase exercise among perinatal woman ( Lewis et al. , 2011 ) usual care . With regard primary aim , investigator predict participant randomize exercise intervention report few depressive symptom ( measure Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale ) 36 week gestation three month postpartum woman usual care condition . The secondary aim examine efficacy exercise intervention moderate prenatal weight gain facilitate postpartum weight loss . The investigator also examine several potential mediator ( e.g. , depression coping , self-efficacy , perceive stress , sleep , fatigue ) effect exercise intervention maternal ( e.g. , hypertension , gestational diabetes , mode delivery ) infant outcome ( e.g. , birth weight , gestational age delivery , breastfeeding , safe sleep ) .
